title: Different compilation output for [Truffle 5.0.0 with Solc 0.4.24] vs [Truffle 4.1.14]
body:
## Issue

I am trying to upgrade from Truffle 4.1.14 to Truffle 5.0.0, without changing code (contracts and tests).

Truffle 4.1.14 uses Solc 0.4.24 for compilation.

I have therefore configured Truffle 5.0.0 to use Solc 0.4.24, as described in your [release notes](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/releases/tag/v5.0.0-beta.0#bring-your-own-compiler).

Since I maintain all compilation output under version control, it is easy for me to track changes.

I see that the byte-code generated by Truffle 5.0.0 is entirely different, i.e., not just the metadata part (those 64 bytes which appear right before the last 2 bytes).

This leads me to conclude that Truffle 5.0.0 doesn't quite keep the promise of using the compiler version that I specify.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Write a simple contract.
2. Install Truffle 4.1.14.
3. Set this in your Truffle configuration file:
```
    solc: {
        optimizer: {
            enabled: true,
            runs: 5000000
        }
    }
```
4. Compile your contract via `truffle compile`, take the output JSON file and save the value of the `bytecode` field somewhere.
5. Install Truffle 5.0.0.
6. Set this in your Truffle configuration file:
```
    compilers: {
        solc: {
            version: "0.4.24",
            optimizer: {
                enabled: true,
                runs: 5000000
            }
        }
    }
```
7. Compile your contract via `truffle compile`, take the output JSON file and save the value of the `bytecode` field somewhere.
8. Compare between the two byte-codes.

Try putting `optimizer` inside a `settings` object and see if that changes anything.

Also, if you have the chance, can you run [truffle-code-utils](
https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/blob/develop/packages/truffle-code-utils/index.js) on the two differing bytecodes and paste the results here? So I can take a quick look.

Either way, thanks for reporting!

@gnidan:
Thank you for your quick response.
My code had failed to compile before I configured Truffle 5.0.0 to use Solc 0.4.24, but it compiled successfully afterwards.
So for the sake of the problem at hand, I don't see any point applying your suggestion. I mean, it will either compile the same as now, or not compile at all. If you still think otherwise, then I will be happy to give it a try.
Thanks.

My second suggestion is just so I can take a quick glance to see how the semantics of the opcodes look (if there are similar looping constructs, etc.)

No matter, just a suggestion in case I get another chance to peek at my phone amidst holiday festivities.

It seems strange that the compilation output would differ. I'll have more suggestions to offer for investigation, but it'll have to wait for me to get back on my computer.

Thank you for raising this issue! It has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. If you would like to keep this issue open, please respond with information about the current state of this problem.

There has been no new activity on this issue since it was marked as stale 7 days ago, so it is being automatically closed.  If you'd like help with this or a different problem, please open a new issue. Thanks!
